{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3664449,"name":"Nick.kremer","username":"Nick.kremer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nick.kremer/{size}/174932_2.png","created_at":"2025-06-25T20:34:01.082Z","cooked":"

Hello CD,

I’m looking at purchasing a tapping arm for 3512 and I’m looking for some recommendations. From what I can tell, a number of teams picked up this Vevor model last year, however it seems to be out of stock everywhere.

It can be electric or pneumatic, we can accommodate either. Typical use case would be tapping up to and including 1/4-20 into 6061 aluminum no thicker than 3/8".

Thanks in advance!
Nick Kremer

Not quite what you have listed, but:

When I was in engineering in undergrad the shop had a vintage cast iron model that was at about knee height which was down right awesome, we used it on fiddly little stuff down to about M3 where perpendicularly really mattered. It was just a cast iron table with a carefully trimmed in vice underneath and an overhead arm which housed a manual spindle/counterweight. It was hefty enough to do at least 1/2-13 if not larger through steel plate. I can’t seem to find an image of one online so…

There are also some benchtop versions I know nothing about: iDili Manual Vertical Tapping Machine Small Hand Adjustable Tap Wrench Table Winch Lengthened Ratchet Swing Probe Arm - Amazon.com

grizzly.com

Grizzly G8748 - Hand Tapping Machine - Grizzly Industrial, Inc.

Our G8748 Hand Tapping Machine provides stability, precision and sensitivity to the hand tapping process. The cast iron construction of the base and over-arm gives a rigid setup that resists tool breakage. Precision ground surfaces on the base and...

We were looking for the same thing. After asking Allen a couple of questions over on Spectrum 3847 | Build Blog 2024 - #641 by adias, we decided to buy Universal Flexible Arm Pneumatic Air Tapping Machine 360° Angle 1000mm M3-M12 U | eBay (the cheap ones all look the same so rolling the dice purely based on price) and we’ll pair it with a Lyndex T05-010 torque control collet for 10-32. We got lucky (I hope - we’ll see when we get them) and found a set of the Lyndex collets on ebay for just over $100. We just ordered this week and shipping is going to take a while so I obviously can’t speak to how well it works

Edit: hilarious. Looking at the link now, the shipping is no longer free and is absurd so I wouldn’t recommend that one to anyone
